means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 卡洛住所名称，来源于古英语，含义是“光秃+山”(bare+hill)，“寒冷+山”(cold+hill)，或“光秃+隐匿处”(bare+nook)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏，] 卡洛语源不详
[人名] [马恩岛人姓氏] 卡洛盖尔语姓氏的英语形式，来源于人名，含义是“苗条的，清秀的”(slender,comely)

sentence.Network_en: He was a callow youth when he joined the newspaper.
sentence.Network_cn: 他进报社时还是个乳臭未干的小子.

sentence.Network_en: Like callow birds left desert to the skies.
sentence.Network_cn: 你的庇护,它们就要战栗--就象/那羽翼未丰的小鸟给撇下在天空里.

sentence.Network_en: He was only a callow youth.
sentence.Network_cn: 他只是个无经验的年轻人.

callout 插图编号callow 年轻的calls 调用

list.abs: this is one of the hidden features of the political machine : the callow age of many its cogs , including some big ones .政治这部机器中许多小齿轮，包括一些大的，他们年轻的年龄是是政治机器隐藏的特点之一。
callousity 茧胼胝callow 幼稚乳臭未乾callow thinking 幼稚想法callowness callus 胼胝茧子硬瘤
A callow youth ., 一个尚未成熟的青年.
he was only a callow youth ., 他只是个无经验的年轻人.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English calu 'bald', of West Germanic origin, probably from Latin calvus 'bald'. This was extended to mean 'unfledged', which led to the present sense 'immature'

entry.tran: 年轻幼稚的;涉世不深的；乳臭未干的
entry.def: A callow young person has very little experience or knowledge of the way they should behave as an adult.
